nodes.long_description:
# Google Earth 3D, now with the highest quality on the market
- The ever-growing coverage includes nearly **all recognizable cities on Earth in 3D**, meaning even your real life residence may be part of it!
- WorldLens offers the best close-up 3D quality on the platform, enhanced by the AI-powered ’Upscale 3D Imagery’ feature
# Street View
- Raw 8k quality with the best rendering fidelity on the platform, offering all **Google** and **Community** Imagery on Earth
- Travel across timelines with the Time Travel feature
# Multiplayer
- Explore with friends!
# World AI can
- Naturally communicate in your own language
- Visualize / understand your virtual surroundings and location for intelligent responses
- Be your travel guide
- Take you on tours
- .. + Much more
# Realistic Graphics
- True-to-life lighting based on the adjustable day / night cycle
- Lifelike, adaptive ‘Haze’
# 3D Quality
- The level of detail can be freely adjusted, allowing fine details and producing realistic 3D with incredibly smooth performance
# Comfort Settings
- Comfort Options (Snap Turning, Movement Vignette) to prevent motion sickness
- Input Remapping (Customizable Movement Controls)
# Easy Navigation
- Quick Maps view: auto/manual altitude-based zoom, paired with compass for orientation
- Integrated full Google Maps experience
# Hand Tracking
- Fly by simply pointing your index finger
- Rotate by doing a "steering" gesture with your own hands

—

WorldLens is committed to ensuring the best possible travel experience.
Bon voyage! 🌍
nodes.short_description:
Travel the World in VR. (Best 3D Map Quality & Street View Fidelity on the Market) -
for more info, see: worldlens.site

nodes.long_description:
Quest 2 Game made in Unity with the Cesium Package using the Google Earth Photogrammetry 3d Tiles.

---------------------------------------------
UPDATE v10 !! : hopefully the MOST STABLE and the Update that Simplified the Flight Controlling Mechanic the Most, v10 is meant to finalize the heavy game development for a month or two, however, fixes and improvements will still come if there are any needs for it. this Update adds Controller SUPPORT!!! basically the rest is self explanatory, the update also fixes a bug that due to the collider removal and raycast to prevent going through mesh, even if the Earth's Mesh was not visible in Space, it was still there, so the raycast stopped Player Movement when trying to go down, this was Fortunately FIXED!,

v10.2: the Controllers are now Able to Type on Keyboard to Search and Teleport to a specific Place on Earth, and fixed a bug where the space bar touch collider was small,

v10.3: when you pressed on some specific ui buttons, the code gave an error and every other ui stopped working since they had the same script. this was fixed. 3d Earth Generation to have better quality and faster performance, also loading faster and in larger quantity, we'll have to know if that's the case, if not we'll have to redo the changes in v10.4 :/, another improvement was that flight speed adjustment based on altitude was not efficient, and sometimes caused teleporting instead of flying smoothly, fixed !
https://youtu.be/6s-jkai4_mA
---------------------
nodes.short_description: geography teaching hand tracking passthrough VR app/game on Quest 2 Quest Pro, and Quest 3

nodes.change_log:
WorldLens v48 is LIVE!

# Tap to Go 👇

- A new navigation system is now available!

- Enlarge the Map, tap where you want to go, and confirm!

https://youtu.be/UCzzt0shK2k

- This system is implemented at the core of the WorldLens experience. Here’s one example: If you have the Street View Overlay enabled, tapping to go will automatically load Street View at that location; with it, you can browse 100s of Community or Google images in minutes!

- Browsing Earth with this level of accuracy and speed makes navigation feel so effortless and magical.

# Space Labels Update 🔹

- 3D labels now take both spacing and population into account, delivering better readability and a far more pleasant navigation and search experience.

- Loading times have also improved, showing up places more conveniently as you navigate.

- Highly populated cities will now load from further away, in a slightly larger radius around you; improving visibility range.

# Design Improvements ⚜️

- Redesigned ‘How to Use’ Input Mode control scheme visualization, now offering a cleaner, more consistent design.

- Larger Enlarged Map display size for better visibility.

- Subtle design continuity improvements (such as design-consistent rounded corners)

- Two-state Input Modes such as the Thumbstick Input Mode now show which state they’re in.

# Chinese and Japanese UI character support 🇨🇳🇯🇵

- WorldLens can now render Chinese and Japanese characters for UI use.

- This means that UI like World AI responses can now render Chinese and Japanese content, no longer showing invalid ▪️ characters.

# Additional 🔧

- Increased World AI vision resolution by roughly 2x, delivering better visual multimodal understanding and smarter responses (v48.05).

- Solved remaining Street View navigation bug (v48.05).

- Improved Street View immersive path visualization (v48.05).

- Faster Street View loading times (v48.04).

- Faster initial 3D loading times (startup loading and teleportation).

- If Google fails to fulfill a tile request in time, WorldLens should now automatically retry requesting it.

- Fixed floating point errors when standing close to a surface at very high altitudes (tip of Mount Everest for example). This prevents visual jitter due to imprecision at large distances.

- Improved CPU and GPU performance. Potentially smoother FPS.

- Improved memory usage stability.

- The Hub (Main Menu) now provides a first-time introductory animation, showcasing interactions and menu access.

- Accidental UI presses are now less probable overall.

- 3D loading distance has further been increased to ensure no render distance cut offs are EVER noticeable. Providing a seemingly 1:1 infinite render distance while skipping computation for obstructed/hidden tiles.

- Faster ‘Search for Place’ autocomplete loading times.

- Increased Street View timeouts to reduce the probability of loading incomplete imagery on slower connection.

- Fixed potential map zoom fluctuations as 3D is loading.

- Fixed a bug where 1.9x display resolution would produce lag.

- Improved collision detection and movement freedom with larger scales.

- Fixed some small Street View issues.

- And much more!

Everything was thoroughly tested (and will continue to be), but if you encounter ANYTHING that you may think isn’t 100% intentional, please LET ME KNOW!

contact.worldlens.site

WorldLens v48 is LIVE!

# Tap to Go 👇

- A new navigation system is now available!

- Enlarge the Map, tap where you want to go, and confirm!

https://youtu.be/UCzzt0shK2k

- This system is implemented at the core of the WorldLens experience. Here’s one example: If you have the Street View Overlay enabled, tapping to go will automatically load Street View at that location; with it, you can browse 100s of Community or Google images in minutes!

- Browsing Earth with this level of accuracy and speed makes navigation feel so effortless and magical.

# Space Labels Update 🔹

- 3D labels now take both spacing and population into account, delivering better readability and a far more pleasant navigation and search experience.

- Loading times have also improved, showing up places more conveniently as you navigate.

- Highly populated cities will now load from further away, in a slightly larger radius around you; improving visibility range.

# Design Improvements ⚜️

- Redesigned ‘How to Use’ Input Mode control scheme visualization, now offering a cleaner, more consistent design.

- Larger Enlarged Map display size for better visibility.

- Subtle design continuity improvements (such as design-consistent rounded corners)

- Two-state Input Modes such as the Thumbstick Input Mode now show which state they’re in.

# Chinese and Japanese UI character support 🇨🇳🇯🇵

- WorldLens can now render Chinese and Japanese characters for UI use.

- At the moment this means that World AI can now render Chinese and Japanese content correctly, instead of rendering “invalid” ▪️ characters.

- Since Chinese and Japanese are very large to store in memory, WorldLens only supports frequently used Chinese and Japanese characters, this enables the languages to render without consuming valuable memory.

- I plan to update Chinese and Japanese character support in time, so if an essential character is not supported, let me know!

# Additional 🔧

- Faster Street View Continuous Navigation with the ‘Auto’ quality mode.

- Faster initial 3D loading times (startup loading and teleportation).

- If Google fails to fulfill a tile request in time, WorldLens should now automatically retry requesting it.

- Fixed floating point errors when standing close to a surface at very high altitudes (tip of Mount Everest for example). This prevents visual jitter due to imprecision at large distances.

- Improved CPU and GPU performance. Potentially smoother FPS.

- Improved memory usage stability.

- The Hub (Main Menu) now provides a first-time introductory animation, showcasing interactions and menu access.

- Accidental UI presses are now less probable overall.

- 3D loading distance has further been increased to ensure no render distance cut offs are EVER noticeable. Providing a seemingly 1:1 infinite render distance while skipping computation for obstructed/hidden tiles.

- Faster ‘Search for Place’ autocomplete loading times.

- Increased Street View timeouts to reduce the probability of loading incomplete imagery on slower connection.

- Fixed potential map zoom fluctuations as 3D is loading.

- Fixed a bug where 1.9x display resolution would produce lag.

- Improved collision detection and movement freedom with larger scales.

- Fixed some small Street View issues.

- And much more!

Everything was thoroughly tested (and will continue to be), but if you encounter ANYTHING that you may think isn’t 100% intentional, please LET ME KNOW!

contact.worldlens.site

- And much more!
